node.title: Firefighters battle through the night to contain blaze still threatening lives and homes near Margaret River
node.alt: Three people stand on a remote beach looking at thick smoke from a bushfire filling the horizon in the distance.
node.description: An emergency warning remains in place for a bushfire that has been burning in the Margaret River region in Western Australia's South West since yesterday.
node.content:
["Fire crews have spent the night battling an out-of-control blaze that has been burning near Margaret River\u00a0in Western Australia's South West\u00a0since yesterday morning.", "An emergency warning remains in place for the area south of Redgate Road, east to Caves Road, south to Sebbes Road and north of Point Road, with lives and homes still under threat.", "Authorities said anyone in that area was in danger and needed\u00a0to act immediately to survive.", "Watch and act and advice-level warnings have also been issued for neighbouring areas.", "The Department of Fire and Emergency Services (DFES) said the blaze was moving in a north-westerly direction and had not yet been contained or controlled.", "At least 1,050 hectares have so far been burnt by the fire, which was reported shortly before 10:00am yesterday.", "About 100 firefighters are working to both directly fight the fire and strengthen containment lines.", "Aerial support was unable to operate overnight, but authorities will decide this morning if it is needed.", "
Cooler temperatures expected
", "Steven McGibbony from the Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) said winds in the area were expected to reach about 30 kilometres per hour\u00a0this morning, with maximum temperatures forecast to hit around 29 degrees Celsius.", "\"So although the temperatures are a little bit milder than we saw yesterday, we do see those north to north-eastly winds picking up and becoming fresh and gusty at times this morning,\"\u00a0he said.", "\"They will tend north and then north-westerly into the afternoon with that change.\"", "A number of roads have been closed, including Caves Road from the Redgate Road intersection to Boranup Drive in the south, and Forest Grove to the east.", "The national park and\u00a0campgrounds including Conto, Point Road and Boranup\u00a0have been shut.", "Tourist attractions including Calgardup Cave and Giants Cave have also been closed for the second day in a row.", "An evacuation centre has been set up at the Margaret River Recreation Centre."]
